Module uk.gov.gchq.eventlogging
Package event.logging.impl

Class DefaultEventLoggingService

  • java.lang.Object
    • event.logging.impl.DefaultEventLoggingService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventLoggingService
    public class DefaultEventLoggingService
extends java.lang.Object
implements EventLoggingService

    This is the default implementation of EventLoggingService for logging events. By default it writes serialised events to an SLF4J logger when log(Event) is called.

    It is recommended to extend this class and override the {EventLoggingService.createEvent()} methods to create a common skeleton event for your system.

    Set the java system property event.logging.validate to true to enable validation of the serialised XML against the XML Schema. This has a performance overhead so is disabled by default.

    If you want the serialised XML events to be consumed by something other than SLF4J then create your own implementation of LogReceiver and set the Java system property event.logging.logreceiver to the class name of your class.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DefaultEventLoggingService

        public DefaultEventLoggingService()
        Uses QuietErrorHandler and ValidationExceptionBehaviourMode.LOG for validation (if enabled), i.e. it will attempt to validate as much of the event as possible, logging all validation messages in one ERROR/WARN SLF4J log message at the end of validation.

        See DefaultEventLoggingService(Supplier, ValidationExceptionBehaviourMode) for more control of validation behaviour.

      • DefaultEventLoggingService

        public DefaultEventLoggingService​(java.util.function.Supplier<ValidationErrorHandler> validationErrorHandlerSupplier)
        Uses the ValidationErrorHandler supplied by validationErrorHandlerSupplier and ValidationExceptionBehaviourMode.LOG for validation (if enabled), i.e. it will log all validation messages in one ERROR/WARN SLF4J log message at the end of validation. The implementation of the ValidationErrorHandler will determine whether only the first problem is logged or all are logged.

        See DefaultEventLoggingService(Supplier, ValidationExceptionBehaviourMode) for more control of validation behaviour.

        Parameters:
        validationErrorHandlerSupplier - Supplies a new instance of a ValidationErrorHandler to handle validation warnings/errors.

      • DefaultEventLoggingService

        public DefaultEventLoggingService​(java.util.function.Supplier<ValidationErrorHandler> validationErrorHandlerSupplier,
                                  ValidationExceptionBehaviourMode validationExceptionBehaviourMode)
        If you want this service to throw an exception if the event fails validation then we recommend passing a supplier of a QuietErrorHandler and ValidationExceptionBehaviourMode.THROW.

        If you want this service to simply log validation messages to a Logger then we recommend using the no-args constructor DefaultEventLoggingService().

        Parameters:
        validationErrorHandlerSupplier - Supplies a new instance of a ValidationErrorHandler to handle validation warnings/errors.
        validationExceptionBehaviourMode - Controls how the validator handles exceptions thrown by the ValidationErrorHandler as supplied by validationErrorHandlerSupplier.

      • loggedWorkBuilder

        public EventLoggerBuilder.TypeIdStep loggedWorkBuilder()
        Description copied from interface: EventLoggingService
        Creates a builder to assist with logging an event for a Runnable or Supplier. This method allows for a piece of work to be run and logged in one go with any exceptions being logged appropriately. By default if an exception is throw in the logged work then a failure outcome will be added to the
        Specified by:
        loggedWorkBuilder in interface EventLoggingService
        Returns:
        A builder instance.

      • setValidate

        public void setValidate​(java.lang.Boolean validate)
        Set to true if the event logging service should validate the output XML against the schema. This option helps identify areas of code that are producing invalid data. For performance reasons it is recommended that validation is not performed in production.

        If validate is set to null then the system property shall be used to determine if validation is performed.

        Specified by:
        setValidate in interface EventLoggingService
        Parameters:
        validate - The validation flag.

      • isValidate

        public boolean isValidate()
        Use to determine if the event logging service is set to validate data against the XML schema. Takes into account the value supplied by setValidate(Boolean) and the value of system property event.logging.validate.
        Specified by:
        isValidate in interface EventLoggingService
        Returns:
        True if the validate flag is set.
